item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Sir, there is nothing too little for so little creature as man. It is by studying little things that we attain the great knowledge of having as little misery and as much happiness as possible. 16, July 1763." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For it would seem - her case proved it - that we write, not with the fingers, but with the whole person. The nerve which controls the pen winds itself about every fibre of our being, threads the heart, pierces the liver." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The world is changed because you are made of ivory and gold. The curves of your lips rewrite history." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "It is fate that I am here,' George persisted, 'but you can call it Italy if it makes you less unhappy." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Antoinette add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch
